result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latisha Nicole Shelton

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Justice Point Discharge Report forwarded to the Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Latisha Nicole Shelton not in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Latisha Nicole Shelton.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Latisha Nicole Shelton not in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Latisha Nicole Shelton.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pretrial conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued a STAYED bench warrant until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to 9-16-22 at 8:30 am for a calendar call.
Calendar call scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with SNR (DOB: 04/21/1968)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Latisha Nicole Shelton in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Latisha Nicole Shelton in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latisha Nicole Shelton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
